ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Fear or anxiety keeps me from getting primary care.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Embarrassment keeps me from getting primary care.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I worry that the stress of interacting with the healthcare system will cause me to lose control of myself (e.g. melt down, shut down, freak out).
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Frustration or anger keeps me from getting primary care.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Lack of confidence keeps me from getting primary care.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Fatigue or pain keeps me from getting primary care.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(I have trouble following up on care (for example, going to pharmacy, taking prescribed drugs at the right time, or making a follow-up appointment).)
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I often miss appointments due to memory problems.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I have trouble following medical instructions in the way they are presented to me.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(I have difficulty understanding how to translate medical information into concrete steps that I can take to improve my health.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) (I don't understand the healthcare system or I find it too hard to work through (e.g. managed care, billing system).)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) (It is too difficult to make appointments / I find it too hard to seek primary care or follow-up with primary care.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(I have problems filling out paperwork.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(My behaviors are misinterpreted by my provider or the staff.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) My providers or the staff do not believe me when I tell them that new symptoms I experience are not related to an existing condition or disability.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(My providers or the staff do not take my communications seriously.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) My providers or the staff are unwilling to communicate with me in the mode I''ve specified (e.g. writing down instructions instead of saying them out loud).

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(I cannot find a healthcare provider who will accommodate my needs.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(My providers or the staff do not include me in discussions about my health)
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I cannot process information fast enough to participate in real-time discussions about healthcare.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I have difficulty communicating with my doctors or the staff.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I have trouble following spoken directions.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Appointments are too short to accommodate my communication needs.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I have difficulty moving or communicating effectively when in crisis.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(When I experience pain and/or other physical symptoms, I have difficulties identifying them and reporting them to my healthcare provider.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Healthcare facilities cause me sensory discomfort (e.g. the lights, smells, or sounds make visits uncomfortable).

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Sensory issues (e.g. sensitivity to light, sounds, or smells) make it difficult for me to communicate well in healthcare settings.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Sensory issues (e.g. sensitivity to light, sounds, or smells) make tests, screenings and medical exams difficult or impossible.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Concern about the cost of care keeps me from getting primary care.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I don''t have insurance coverage.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) My insurance coverage does not cover medications or the co-payments are too high.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) My insurance coverage does not cover care coordination services.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I have trouble getting reimbursements for atypical treatments (e.g. pool therapy).
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Transportation costs too much.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I live in rural area or the doctor''s office is too far away.
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I am socially isolated.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(I have inadequate social, family, or caregiver support.)
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) I have difficulty getting personal assistance.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(I find it hard to handle the waiting room.)
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) The wait in the healthcare office is too long for me.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(Fear, anxiety, embarrassment, or frustration keeps me from getting primary care.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(Communication with my healthcare provider or the staff is too difficult.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(Sensory discomforts (for example, the lights, smells or sounds) get in the way of my healthcare.)
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) Concerns about cost or insurance coverage keep me from getting primary care.

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) 
(I do not have a way to get to my doctor's office.)

Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply)
(Other [other])
Which of the following barriers keep you from receiving good healthcare? (Select all that apply) (None of the above)

Does fear, anxiety, embarrassment, or frustration keep you from getting primary care?
Do you have trouble following up on care (for example, going to pharmacy, taking prescribed drugs at the right time, or making a follow-up appointment)?
Do you have difficulty understanding how to translate medical information into concrete steps that you can take to improve your health?
Do you understand the healthcare system?
Is it too difficult for you to make appointments?
Do you have problems filling out paperwork?
Are your behaviors misinterpreted by the provider or the staff?
Do the providers or the staff take your communications seriously?
Can you find a provider who will accommodate your needs?
Does your providers or the staff include you in discussions about your health?
Are the communications with your healthcare provider or the staff too difficult?
When you experience pain and/or other physical symptoms, do you have difficulties identifying them and reporting them to your healthcare provider?
Do sensory discomforts (for example, sensitivity to light, sounds, or smells) get in the way of your healthcare?
Do concerns about the cost or insurance coverage keep you from getting healthcare?
Notes: 1= Not true; 5= Very true; 9= Does not apply to me
